thread.title: Burnley manager Sean Dyche and Chelsea’s Antonio Conte are best bosses in the Prem, claims Martin Keown
thread.title_full: Burnley manager Sean Dyche and Chelsea’s Antonio Conte are best bosses in the Prem, claims Martin Keown

author: gsweet
title: Burnley manager Sean Dyche and Chelsea’s Antonio Conte are best bosses in the Prem, claims Martin Keown
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments SEAN DYCHE had estabished himself as Sean Dyche as one of the two best managers in the Premier League, according to Match of the Day 2 pundit Martin Keown. Former Arsenal and England central defender Keown insists the unassuming Burnley boss should take his place at the top table alongside along Chelsea’s Antonio Conte. Reuters 4 Sean Dyche and Antonio Conte…top notch Burnley maintained their fiercesome home record with a terrific 1-1 draw against Premier League leaders Chelsea on Sunday when new signing Robbie Brady’s stunning free kick earned a late equaliser. Keep up to date with ALL the Burnley and Chelsea news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary The Clarets actually created the best chances, with Chelsea failing to register even a single shot on target in the second half. Keown ranks Dyche ahead of some of the more popular managers around like Pep Guardiola , Jose Mourinho , and his former Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger. Getty Images Dyche earned a glowing reprise from Martin Keown Getty Images 4 Keown says Dyche took Chelsea ‘out of their comfort zone’ He said: “The whole game was compelling stuff, very much so. They are the best two managers I think in the Premier League at the moment, Sean Dyche and Conte. Related Stories Don't blow chances Italian model on 'million men' referendum sex tour reveals she will perform sex acts on ENTIRE Napoli team if they win Champions League BOTTLE BANKERS Spurs justify their bottlers tag with Liverpool defeat and the Swans are no longer ugly ducklings: Nine things we learnt this weekend 'It's time he started scoring again' Arsene Wenger lays into Mesut Ozil as Hull blank extends barren run to two months THUGS TARGET KOP ACE Sadio Mane's home attacked and £26k motor trashed after Africa Cup of Nations penalty miss SIEGE OF TROY Premier League ace Troy Deeney threatened with pepper spray by cops outside club - after being punched by fans wanting a photo GIMME MOUR LOVE Jose Mourinho claims he doesn't get the credit he deserves because of his style of play while at Chelsea “Two different styles, two different systems, and Burnley really took Chelsea out of their comfort zone today and they worked their socks off, but with intelligence and good quality. “Conte knows his tactics, every player goes on to that pitch knowing his role, but you have to say equally for Sean Dyche’s team, they did as well, and maybe we don’t shout enough about our English coaches. 
“You look at the resources he has there and what he is achieving, four or five of those players went down before, he has come back this time and he is using that extra knowledge. EPA Conte ‘knows his tactics’ well Burnley 1-1 Chelsea : Robbie Brady nets stunning free kick after Pedro opener "He is using a system that I doubted at the start of the season, 4-4-2, but that was a tactical masterpiece today from his team." Ex-Chelsea player and manager Ruud Gullit praised Conte'sdefensive organisation. Robbie Brady scores an amazing free kick for Burnley against Chelsea He said: "The Italians, they always think about the defence first. At the beginning of the season, when they were winning 3-0, 4-0 or whatever, the first thing he said is I am content that we did not concede any goals, that’s a typical Italian, he wants to have that solid base."
